thread.title: Small plane found near New Jersey airport 2 days after takeoff; was reported missing earlier Thursday - @ABC7NY
thread.title_full: Small plane found near New Jersey airport 2 days after takeoff; was reported missing earlier Thursday - @ABC7NY

author: Tricia McDermott
title: Small plane found near New Jersey airport 2 days after takeoff; was reported missing earlier Thursday - @ABC7NY
text: NEWS Pilot dead in crash of small plane near Somerset Airport in New Jersey You need Flash to watch this video. Sorry, your browser doesn't support Flash , needs a Flash update , or has Flash disabled. Anthony Johnson has the latest Embed <iframe width="476" height="270" src="http://abc7ny.com/video/embed/?pid=977707" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe> By Thursday, September 10, 2015 06:24PM BEDMINSTER (WABC) -- Police say a pilot has been found dead after a small plane crashed near Somerset Airport in New Jersey.The victim, the only person who was on board, is 62 years old from Chester Township, NJ, but his identity has not yet been released.Federal Aviation Administration officials confirmed that the missing Lake LA-4-250 plane was found Thursday near Somerset Airport.The single-engine aircraft departed from the airport at 9:45 p.m. on Tuesday, September 8. It was reported missing earlier Thursday.The FAA and the National Transportation Safety Board are investigating. They will check maintenance records and try to determine the cause of the crash.Police say the plane was missing anywhere from 24-72 hours.The man was located as a result of a missing persons complaint made by the family. Family members have been gathering at the airport.The debris field was contained with a close proximity of the crash.The missing plane was spotted in a patch of thick brush near a wooded area past the runway at the airport.It is one of the smaller airports that does not have a control tower, and pilots move in and out using visual flight rules.
